p: In brief, the test, standard (rutin, 0.1 mg/mL; ascorbic acid, 0.05 mg/mL) or control solutions were transferred (0.1 mL) into test tubes and 3.0 mL of ex tempore prepared FRAP reagent (25 mL acetate buffer, 300 mmol/L, pH 3.6 + 2.5 mL 10 mmol/L TPTZ in 40 mmol/L HCl + 2.5 mL 20 mmol/L FeCl 3 × 6H 2O) was added. The absorbances were recorded at 593 nm against a blank containing 0.1 mL of solvent after 30 min incubation at 37 °C. FRAP values were calculated from the calibration curve of FeSO 4 × 7H 2O solutions, covering the concentration range between 100 and 1000 μmol/L, and expressed as mmol Fe 2+/g dry extract (mmol Fe 2+/g). All measurements were performed in triplicate.
